metadata.title: CVE-2022-48888 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/msm/dpu: Fix memory leak in msm_mdss_parse_data_bus_icc_pathof_icc_get() alloc resources for path1, we should release it when notneed anymore. Early return when IS_ERR_OR_NULL(path0) may leak path1.Defer getting path1 to fix this.Patchwork: https://patchwork.freedesktop.org/patch/514264/

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48888` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
